meanings.definition: A large, highly productive farm that utilizes advanced technology and methods.
meanings.sent1: The superfarm in our town grows a lot of food for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The superfarm down the road uses robots to help with planting and harvesting.
meanings.sent3: I heard the superfarm has a secret underground lab where they grow giant vegetables!
meanings.sent4: Her backyard garden was like a tiny superfarm, bursting with fresh produce.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the superfarm felt like stepping into a futuristic world of agriculture.

meanings.definition: To operate or manage a superfarm.
meanings.sent1: She learned how to superfarm from her grandparents who owned a big farm.
meanings.sent2: The young couple decided to superfarm together and grow organic crops.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if anyone can superfarm, or if it takes a special skill.
meanings.sent4: He superfarmed the land with such efficiency that the harvest was bountiful.
meanings.sent5: Superfarming requires dedication and knowledge of modern agricultural practices.

meanings.definition: The act of transforming a regular farm into a superfarm.
meanings.sent1: The superfarmization of the old farm brought new life and prosperity.
meanings.sent2: After the superfarmification, the farm became a model of innovation.
meanings.sent3: The superfarmification process involved installing high-tech equipment and systems.
meanings.sent4: The superfarmification was complete when the farm started producing record yields.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the superfarmification was like watching magic unfold in the fields.
